content.rendered:
Your car’s muffler is an important component of your car’s exhaust system. It operates as a silencer to help reduce the amount of noise caused from the internal combustion engine. If you remove a muffler or you go too long without replacing it, your car’s acceleration becomes inappropriately loud and can even cause legal issues.

The Average Life of a Muffler

Your muffler wears down overtime. The lifespan of your muffler varies depending on how often you drive your car and the conditions you drive in. Many car’s mufflers last 40,000 to 80,000 miles, or around 2 to 4 years with average driving conditions. If you are driving in areas with severe cold weather, this time may be even shorter. Some cars and auto parts in Chicago have this issue due to cold winters.

When to Get it Repaired

The most obvious symptom signaling the need for a new muffler is when you start hearing the exhaust system much louder. An old muffler is can also be associated with loud rattling noises coming from your car. If these symptoms occur, you should visit a repair shop with auto parts in Chicago to replace your muffler for a more pleasurable driving experience.

Legal Concerns

While you may be tempted to make alterations to your car’s muffler, be aware there are exhaust noise laws in various states. Here are the laws in some Midwest region states:

  • In Minnesota, the state prohibits the use of a muffler that emits “excessive or unusual” noise.
  • In Wisconsin, the state prohibits the use of a muffler that emits “excessive or unusual” noise AND prohibits modification if it causes the muffler to emit more noise than the original, factory-installed muffler.
  • In Illinois, the law is the same as Wisconsin’s. If you have any concerns about your car’s muffler, Aero Auto Parts in Chicago has the professional staff to assess your muffler and exhaust system.

Courtesy Of: Typical LifeSpan of a Muffler
